name: Thomas A. Runkler
content: TUM - Chair VII - Foundations of Software Reliability and Theoretical Computer Science Chair for Foundations of Software Reliability and Theoretical Computer Science Home Contact Teaching People professors secretaries scientific staff associate members sysadmins affiliated scientists affiliated students former staff former students Publications Student Projects Research Help People personal data Prof. Dr.-Ing.Thomas A. Runkler mail-address: Prof. Dr.-Ing. Thomas A. RunklerSiemens AGOtto-Hahn-Ring 681739 München / Germany phone:email:www: +49(89)636-633806thomas.runkler@siemens.comhttp://www.model.in.tum.de/~runkler/ CV: Thomas Runkler received his MS and PhD in electrical engineering from the Technical University of Darmstadt, Germany, in 1992 and 1995, respectively, and was a postdoctoral researcher at the University of West Florida from 1996-1997. He is teaching computer science at the Technical University of Munich, Germany, since 1999, and was appointed adjunct professor in 2011. Since 1997 he is working for Siemens in various expert and management functions, currently as a Senior Principal Research Scientist. Thomas authored and co-authored more than 200 scientific publications. His main research interests include machine learning, data analytics, pattern recognition, and optimization. He is speaker of the Fuzzy Systems and Soft Computing group of the German Association for Computer Science (GI), member of the IEEE CIS Strategic Planning Committee, member of the IEEE CIS Industry Liaison Committee, and member of the IEEE CIS Fuzzy Systems Technical Committee.
